Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 14th overall pick, by Philadelphia in 1969...
Injured on 4/8/1972 with a Strained Thigh Muscle, out for one week...
Injured on 5/5/1972 with a Pulled Back Muscle, out for one week...
Injured on 8/17/1979 with a Bruised Finger, out for 2 days...
Released by Philadelphia on 4/18/1980...
Drafted in 2nd round, 21st overall pick, by Houston in 1985...
Injured on 4/30/1985 with a Strained Back, out for one week...
Injured on 7/27/1986 with a Bruised Wrist, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 8/4/1987 with a Bruised Neck, out for 4 days...
Had first career hit on 5/12/1989, off Rich Gossage (CHC)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/25/1989, off Jeff Holly (ATL)...
Drove in 6 runs against Los Angeles on 5/26/1991...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/2/1991, hitting .455 with 2 HR, 13 RBI...
Won World Series with Houston in 1994...
Won World Series with Houston in 1995...
Signed as a free agent by Atlanta on 2/9/1998 to a 4-year deal worth $720,000 per year...
